prompt:
**Enhanced Prompt:**

```
You will receive one or more pseudocode programs, each fully encapsulated and self-contained. For each pseudocode, evaluate it strictly for reproducibility—that is, whether it is syntactically unambiguous, logically complete, and sufficiently detailed to be implemented correctly to pass all relevant unit tests for its stated functionality without any room for interpretation, missing steps, or logical errors.

For each pseudocode, consider:
- Completeness: all variables, control flow, data structures, and edge cases are fully specified.
- Logical correctness: the steps follow a coherent, sound algorithmic logic that aligns with the expected problem.
- Precision: no ambiguous or vague instructions that could lead to divergent implementations.
- Boundary conditions and error handling are properly addressed.
- Absence of contradictions, inconsistencies, or incomplete constructs.
- No dependency on unstated assumptions or undefined behavior.

Do not infer unstated information or fill in gaps; evaluate solely based on the pseudocode text provided.

After reading each pseudocode, output a single digit on its own line:

- Output 1 if the pseudocode meets all the criteria above and can be reliably implemented to pass all unit tests.
- Output 0 if it fails due to incompleteness, ambiguity, logical flaws, or any other deficiency.

Do not output any explanation, commentary, or additional text.  
The outputs must appear in the exact order the pseudocodes are provided.

Begin now.
```

We have a 4 way split for the pseudocodes: true positives, which are pseudocodes that correspond to code that passes all test cases.
We also have true negatives, which are pseudocodes that correspond to code that do not pass all test cases.
We have cosmetic, which are pseudocodes that are variations of the positive pseudocodes and also pass all test cases.
We have near-misses, which are pseudocodes that correspond to code that almost passes all test cases but do not. They pass at least 80% of test cases

The following are pseudocodes that are reproducible but were labeled as not:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION multiply(num1 string num2 string) RETURNS string  
        IF num1 EQUALS string zero OR num2 EQUALS string zero  
            RETURN string zero  
        END IF  

        SET result TO a list of zeros with the LENGTH OF num1 PLUS the LENGTH OF num2  

        SET num1 TO the reversal of num1  
        SET num2 TO the reversal of num2  

        FOR i FROM zero TO the LENGTH OF num1 MINUS one  
            FOR j FROM zero TO the LENGTH OF num2 MINUS one  
                SET mul TO the character code of the element at position i of num1 MINUS the character code of string zero MULTIPLIED BY the character code of the element at position j of num2 MINUS the character code of string zero  
                SET p1 TO i PLUS j  
                SET p2 TO i PLUS j PLUS one  
                SET sum TO mul PLUS the element at position p1 of result  

                SET the element at position p1 of result TO sum MODULO ten  
                INCREMENT the element at position p2 of result BY the integer division of sum BY ten  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  

        SET result_str TO the concatenation of the string representations of the elements of result in reverse order  
        RETURN result_str with all leading string zeros removed  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION removeDuplicates(nums)  
        IF the LENGTH OF nums EQUALS zero THEN  
            RETURN zero  
        END IF  
        
        SET write_index TO zero  
        
        FOR i FROM zero TO the MINIMUM of two AND the LENGTH OF nums MINUS one  
            SET element at position write_index of nums TO element at position i of nums  
            INCREMENT write_index BY one  
        END FOR  
        
        FOR i FROM two TO the LENGTH OF nums MINUS one  
            IF element at position i of nums NOT EQUALS element at position write_index MINUS two of nums THEN  
                SET element at position write_index of nums TO element at position i of nums  
                INCREMENT write_index BY one  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        
        RETURN write_index  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

original version of the pseudocode for this problem that is reproducible:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION myAtoi(s)  
        SET INT_MAX TO two RAISED TO THE POWER OF thirty ONE MINUS one  
        SET INT_MIN TO the NEGATIVE of two RAISED TO THE POWER OF thirty ONE  
        SET result TO zero  
        SET index TO zero  
        SET n TO the LENGTH OF s  
        SET sign TO one  
        WHILE index LESS THAN n AND element at position index of s EQUALS the space character  
            INCREMENT index BY one  
        END WHILE  
        IF index LESS THAN n AND (element at position index of s EQUALS the plus character OR element at position index of s EQUALS the minus character)  
            IF element at position index of s EQUALS the minus character  
                SET sign TO the NEGATIVE of one  
            ELSE  
                SET sign TO one  
            END IF  
            INCREMENT index BY one  
        END IF  
        WHILE index LESS THAN n AND element at position index of s IS A DIGIT  
            SET digit TO the INTEGER VALUE OF element at position index of s  
            IF result GREATER THAN INT_MAX MINUS digit DIVIDED BY ten  
                IF sign EQUALS one  
                    RETURN INT_MAX  
                ELSE  
                    RETURN INT_MIN  
                END IF  
            END IF  
            SET result TO result MULTIPLIED BY ten PLUS digit  
            INCREMENT index BY one  
        END WHILE  
        RETURN sign MULTIPLIED BY result  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS
modified version of the pseudocode for this problem that is also reproducible:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION myAtoi(s)  
        SET maxIntValue AS (2 ^ 31) - 1  
        SET minIntValue AS 0 - (2 ^ 31)  
        SET accumulatedNumber TO 0  
        SET position TO 0  
        SET lengthOfString TO LENGTH OF s  
        SET polarity TO 1  

        WHILE position < lengthOfString AND s[position] = ' '  
            position ← position + 1  
        END WHILE  

        IF position < lengthOfString THEN  
            SWITCH s[position]  
                CASE '-'  
                    polarity ← 0 - 1  
                    position ← position + 1  
                    BREAK  
                CASE '+'  
                    polarity ← 1  
                    position ← position + 1  
                    BREAK  
            END SWITCH  
        END IF  

        REPEAT UNTIL NOT (position < lengthOfString AND s[position] >= '0' AND s[position] <= '9')  
            SET currentChar TO s[position]  
            SET numericValue TO INTEGER VALUE OF currentChar  
            SET boundaryCheck TO maxIntValue - (numericValue DIV 10)  

            IF accumulatedNumber > boundaryCheck THEN  
                IF polarity = 1 THEN  
                    RETURN maxIntValue  
                ELSE  
                    RETURN minIntValue  
                END IF  
            END IF  

            accumulatedNumber ← (accumulatedNumber * 10) + numericValue  
            position ← position + 1  
        END REPEAT  

        RETURN polarity * accumulatedNumber  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

modified version of the pseudocode for this problem that is also reproducible:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION removeDuplicates(nums)  
        IF NOT (LENGTH OF nums > 0) THEN  
            RETURN 0  
        END IF  
        
        SET ptr AS 0  
        
        SET idx AS 0  
        WHILE idx <= (2 MINUS 1) AND idx <= (LENGTH OF nums MINUS 1)  
            ASSIGN nums[ptr] AS nums[idx]  
            SET ptr AS ptr + 1  
            SET idx AS idx + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        SET cursor AS 2  
        WHILE cursor <= (LENGTH OF nums MINUS 1)  
            IF nums[cursor] = nums[(ptr MINUS 2)] THEN  
                # do nothing, skip increment  
            ELSE  
                ASSIGN nums[ptr] AS nums[cursor]  
                SET ptr AS ptr PLUS 1  
            END IF  
            SET cursor AS cursor + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN ptr  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

SET INT_MAX = 2^31 - 1, INT_MIN = -2^31
INIT res = 0, i = 0, n = len(s), sign = 1
WHILE i < n AND s[i] = ' ' : i += 1
IF i < n AND s[i] IN ['+', '-'] : sign = -1 IF s[i] = '-' ELSE 1; i += 1
WHILE i < n AND s[i].isdigit():
    d = int(s[i])
    IF res > (INT_MAX - d)//10: RETURN INT_MAX IF sign = 1 ELSE INT_MIN
    res = res*10 + d
    i += 1
RETURN sign * res

        SET result TO zero

            IF element at position index of s EQUALS the minus character

            ELSE

            END IF

        END IF

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION multiply(num1 string, num2 string) RETURNS string
        IF num1 IS "0" OR num2 IS "0"
            RETURN "0"
        END IF

        DECLARE digits AS MAP from INT to INT
        DECLARE lengthSum AS INT = LENGTH(num1) + LENGTH(num2)
        FOR index IN RANGE(lengthSum)
            digits[index] = 0
        END FOR

        DECLARE reversed1 AS string = ""
        DECLARE reversed2 AS string = ""
        FOR p FROM LENGTH(num1) - 1 DOWNTO 0
            reversed1 = reversed1 + num1[p]
        END FOR
        FOR q FROM LENGTH(num2) - 1 DOWNTO 0
            reversed2 = reversed2 + num2[q]
        END FOR

        DECLARE function recursiveMul(i INT, j INT) RETURNS VOID
            IF i = LENGTH(reversed1)
                RETURN
            END IF
            IF j = LENGTH(reversed2)
                recursiveMul(i + 1, 0)
                RETURN
            END IF

            DECLARE valA AS INT = ASCII_CODE(reversed1[i]) - ASCII_CODE("0")
            DECLARE valB AS INT = ASCII_CODE(reversed2[j]) - ASCII_CODE("0")
            DECLARE product AS INT = valA * valB
            DECLARE baseIndex AS INT = i + j
            DECLARE nextIndex AS INT = baseIndex + 1
            DECLARE totalSum AS INT = product + digits[baseIndex]

            digits[baseIndex] = totalSum MOD 10
            digits[nextIndex] = digits[nextIndex] + (totalSum DIV 10)

            recursiveMul(i, j + 1)
        END FUNCTION

        CALL recursiveMul(0, 0)

        DECLARE output AS string = ""
        FOR key FROM lengthSum - 1 DOWNTO 0
            output = output + TO_STRING(digits[key])
        END FOR

        WHILE LENGTH(output) > 1 AND output[0] = "0"
            output = SUBSTRING(output, 1)
        END WHILE

        RETURN output
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION multiply(num1 string num2 string) RETURNS string  
        IF num1 EQUALS string zero OR num2 EQUALS string zero  
            RETURN string zero  
        END IF  

        SET result TO a list of zeros with the LENGTH OF num1 PLUS the LENGTH OF num2  

        SET num1 TO the reversal of num1  
        SET num2 TO the reversal of num2  

        FOR i FROM zero TO the LENGTH OF num1 MINUS one  
            FOR j FROM zero TO the LENGTH OF num2 MINUS one  
                SET mul TO the character code of the element at position i of num1 MINUS the character code of string zero MULTIPLIED BY the character code of the element at position j of num2 MINUS the character code of string zero  
                SET p1 TO i PLUS j  
                SET p2 TO i PLUS j PLUS one  
                SET sum TO mul PLUS the element at position p1 of result  

                SET the element at position p1 of result TO sum MODULO ten  
                INCREMENT the element at position p2 of result BY the integer division of sum BY ten  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  

        SET result_str TO the concatenation of the string representations of the elements of result in reverse order  
        RETURN result_str with all leading string zeros removed  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS
CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION isMatch(s, p)
        SET x TO LENGTH(s)
        SET y TO LENGTH(p)
        SET dp TO []
        SET u TO 0
        WHILE u <= x
            SET tempList TO []
            SET v TO 0
            WHILE v <= y
                APPEND False TO tempList
                SET v TO v + 1
            END WHILE
            APPEND tempList TO dp
            SET u TO u + 1
        END WHILE

        SET dp[0][0] TO True

        PROCEDURE fillFirstRow(w)
            IF w > y THEN
                RETURN
            END IF
            IF p[w - 1] = '*'
                SET dp[0][w] TO dp[0][w - 1]
            END IF
            fillFirstRow(w + 1)
        END PROCEDURE

        CALL fillFirstRow(1)

        PROCEDURE processRow(i, j)
            IF i > x THEN
                RETURN
            END IF
            IF j > y THEN
                CALL processRow(i + 1, 1)
                RETURN
            END IF

            SWITCH TRUE
                CASE (p[j - 1] = '*')
                    SET dp[i][j] TO dp[i - 1][j] OR dp[i][j - 1]
                BREAK

                CASE (p[j - 1] = '?' OR s[i - 1] = p[j - 1])
                    SET dp[i][j] TO dp[i - 1][j - 1]
                BREAK

                DEFAULT
                    // dp[i][j] remains False implicitly
                BREAK
            END SWITCH

            processRow(i, j + 1)
        END PROCEDURE

        CALL processRow(1, 1)

        RETURN dp[x][y]
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION isMatch(s, p)  
        SET dp TO a two dimensional list of False with the number of rows equal to the length of s PLUS one and the number of columns equal to the length of p PLUS one  
        SET element at position zero zero of dp TO True  
        FOR j FROM one TO the length of p  
            IF element at position j MINUS one of p EQUALS the character representing asterisk  
                SET element at position zero j of dp TO the value of element at position zero j MINUS one of dp  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        FOR i FROM one TO the length of s  
            FOR j FROM one TO the length of p  
                IF element at position j MINUS one of p EQUALS the character representing asterisk  
                    SET element at position i j of dp TO the value of element at position i MINUS one j of dp OR the value of element at position i j MINUS one of dp  
                ELSE IF element at position j MINUS one of p EQUALS the character representing question mark OR element at position i MINUS one of s EQUALS element at position j MINUS one of p  
                    SET element at position i j of dp TO the value of element at position i MINUS one j MINUS one of dp  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  
        RETURN element at position the length of s the length of p of dp  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION grayCode(n)  
        IF n IS 0 THEN  
            RETURN [0]  
        END IF  
        
        ASSIGN resultList TO grayCode(n - 1)  
        LET bitFlag BE 2 ^ (n - 1) * 1  
        
        DEFINE FUNCTION reverseList(inputList)  
            IF inputList IS EMPTY THEN  
                RETURN []  
            ELSE  
                RETURN reverseList(inputList[1:]) + [inputList[0]]  
            END IF  
        END FUNCTION  
        
        LET reversedResult BE reverseList(resultList)  
        LET extendedList BE []  
        
        FOR each element IN reversedResult DO  
            extendedList = extendedList + [(element BITWISE_OR bitFlag)]  
        END FOR  
        
        RETURN resultList + extendedList  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION grayCode(n)  
        IF n EQUALS zero  
            RETURN a list containing zero  
        END IF  
        SET prev_gray TO the result of calling grayCode with the value of n MINUS one  
        SET mask TO one MULTIPLIED BY two RAISED TO the power of n MINUS one  
        SET current_gray TO concatenation of prev_gray WITH a list constructed by taking each number IN the reversed prev_gray AND applying bitwise OR with mask  
        RETURN current_gray  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS
